page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY W'B'NE VALLEY
page.content: This area rich in prehistoric monuments, especially Bronze Age round barrows or tumuli. They are on high ground for example on the upper slopes of Bronkham Hill and Rew Hill. Many more have been almost flattened by ploughing. There are several neolithic long barrows. There are very clearly defined sets of medieval strip lynchets; long narrow terraces arranged in flights on the hill sides, especially on the south side of the Winterbourne valley and south-west of Steepleton village. Hardy Monument is a stone tower built in 1844 as a viewpoint in memory of Admiral Hardy. The Church of St.Michael is mainly medieval with modern additions. Built in to the exterior of the south wall, a flying angel is carved in a stone block, generally believed to be Saxon.
